segments.key_quote: This child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna by following in his footsteps. In magnanimity, he will be as great as King Rantideva. And in religion, he will be like Maharaj Yayati.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.12.24) that will be discussed, focusing on the qualities predicted for Parikshit.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet In this session, we will be discussing from the 24th verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This will be the first part of this discussion. This entire verse will be discussed in three parts. So part 1, the verse itself, the 24th verse. Sarva Sadguna Mahatmya Esha Krishnam Anuvrataha Rantideva Ivodaro Yayatir Iva Dharmikaha Sarva Sadguna Mahatmya Esha Krishnam Anuvrataha The meaning of this verse is: This child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna by following in his footsteps. In magnanimity, he will be as great as King Rantideva. And in religion, he will be like Maharaj Yayati.

segments.key_quote: The brahmanas are describing this child is going to grow up to be a great devotee, a pure devotee of the Lord, and he'll have wonderful qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the context of the verse, describing the inquiry of Maharaj Yudhishthira and the brahmanas' response about Parikshit's future qualities.
segments.transcript: So three comparisons have been made in this particular verse. This comparison is being made by the brahmanas who are performing the jatakarma samskara of child Parikshit, just after his birth. And brahmanas are addressing Maharaj Yudhishthira, who was inquiring from the brahmanas, "Will this child be having good qualities when he grows up, and will he be a proper successor for me?" That's the enquiry made by Yudhishthira. And in response to that, the brahmanas are describing this child is going to grow up to be a great devotee, a pure devotee of the Lord, and he'll have wonderful qualities. And they're mentioning specifically those, what are those qualities.

segments.key_quote: Sarva dharman parityajya mam ekam sharanam vraja.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Srila Prabhupada's explanation of Krishna's final instruction in the Bhagavad Gita, emphasizing the importance of surrendering to Krishna and the difference between intelligent and less intelligent people in following this instruction.
segments.transcript: So, as good as Lord Krishna by following in his footsteps. This is explained by Prabhupada in the purport. Srila Prabhupada says, the last instruction of Lord Sri Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita is that, one should give up everything and should follow in the footsteps of the Lord alone. Sarva dharman parityajya mam ekam sharanam vraja. This is Krishna's final instruction in the Bhagavad Gita, 18th chapter, 66th verse. Then further Srila Prabhupada says, less intelligent persons do not have the power to do good deeds. Less intelligent persons do not have the power to do good deeds. segments.key_quote: Association is the cause of acquiring qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of association for acquiring good qualities, highlighting that pure devotees and the Supreme Lord possess all good qualities.
segments.transcript: of acquiring qualities. If I want to develop good qualities or acquire good qualities, I should associate with people or a person who has got all good qualities. Now who is the one who has got all good qualities? Two different classes of people have all good qualities. One is a pure devotee of the Lord. One class of persons who has all good qualities is a pure devotee of the Lord. Yasyasti bhaktir bhagavati akinchana sarvair gunai sthatra samasate surah, the statement of the Bhagavatam fifth canto: a pure devotee has all the good qualities that are to be found in the devatas, in the divine persons, divine qualities, all good qualities. And the second category is obviously the Supreme Lord who has unlimited good qualities. Samasta guna Gana dhama, this is the statement of Srila Bhaktivinoda Thakur that the Supreme Lord is full of all wonderful qualities.

segments.key_quote: To follow the instructions of the Lord means to associate with the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that following the instructions of the Lord is equivalent to associating with Him due to the absolute nature of the Lord and His instructions (Advayagyana).
segments.transcript: by intimate association with Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Now how to associate with the Lord? If that question is asked, Srila Prabhupada says, to follow the instructions of the Lord is to associate with the Lord. Why? Why is it said like this? Because the Lord is absolute. There is no difference between the Lord, His name, His form, His qualities, His instructions, there is no difference. Both are, all are absolute. Advayagyana, this is called Advayagyana. So there is no difference between the Lord and His instructions.

segments.key_quote: The Lord is present everywhere and at all times.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that associating with Krishna is not about physical contact but about understanding His transcendental nature and omnipresence.
segments.transcript: So to follow the instructions of the Lord means to associate with the Lord. Now, Srila Prabhupada also says that we should not mistakenly think to associate with Krishna is something like, a material presence. The Lord is not a material object whose presence one has to feel for such association. Like in our ordinary day to day dealings, material dealings, to associate means we think in terms of physical association, physical contact. But no, the Lord, you cannot have association with Krishna with krishna by physical contact, not possible. It's not possible because God is not at all having any material attributes, he does not have any material qualities or material characteristics. So with these material eyes we cannot see the transcendental form of the Lord, with our material senses we cannot perceive the presence of the Lord who is always transcendentally present, transcendentally available like that. And further Srila Prabhupada says the Lord is present everywhere and at all times. segments.key_quote: The Lord can be present everywhere simultaneously.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the limited presence of jivas with the Lord's omnipresence as Brahman and Paramatma, reiterating that association with Him is possible by following His instructions.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Parikshit associated with the Lord even from the womb of his mother up to the last day of his valuable life.
segments.summary: The speaker returns to the topic of Parikshit, explaining how his association with Krishna began in the womb when Krishna saved him from the Brahmastra.
segments.transcript: because the Lord and his instruction are all identical with him, being absolute knowledge, Advaya Gyan. Now, regarding Parikshit, what is being told here? Parikshit, it was told that this child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna by following in his footsteps. So, it is said here that Maharaj Parikshit associated with the Lord even from the womb of his mother up to the last day of his valuable life. We discussed this earlier, when Parikshit was in his mother's womb, one Ashwatthama, son of Dronacharya, he attempted to kill this last surviving descendant of the Pandavas. And he was killed by releasing one Brahmastra. Now, Brahmastra, it goes and strikes the target wherever the target is. And only the target, nothing else. But, Parikshit was saved from this attack of Brahmastra by Krishna personally. And Krishna entered the womb of Parikshit's mother, Uttara, Abhimanyu's wife. So, Krishna entered personally and protected the child.

segments.key_quote: Even though I am equal to everyone, but I am specially inclined to my pure devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing Krishna's special interest in His devotees and how Parikshit continued to associate with Krishna until the end of his life, ultimately acquiring all good qualities, ending with Hare Krishna.
segments.transcript: Because Krishna has interest in the pure devotee, special interest. Ye bhajan titumam bhaktya maite teshu chaapyaham. Krishna says this in the Bhagavad Gita. Even though I am equal to everyone, but I am specially inclined to my pure devotees. That's what Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita. So, accordingly, Krishna entered the womb of Mother Uttara, when Parikshit was present in that womb. And Krishna neutralized the Brahmastra and Parikshit was saved. And since that time, his association with Krishna began till the end of his life. The whole Bhagavatam is about Parikshit being cursed when he was ruling. He was cursed to die untimely, to die within seven days. And he accepted to quit the body after seven days. But he wanted to prepare. And he decided to go to holy place. And actually, Krishna prepared himself for quitting the body. And he had association of saintly persons, specially Srila Shukadeva Goswami, from whom he heard the Bhagavatam. So, till the end, he had association of Krishna in that way. And he acquired all good qualities of Krishna in all perfection. So, I will stop here. Thank you very much.
